intro: Corynostylis pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri grass, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist and nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native environment.
